meanings.definition: Giving or intended as a remedy or cure.
meanings.sent1: The teacher provided remedial help to the struggling student.
meanings.sent2: She took a remedial class to improve her math skills.
meanings.sent3: The remedial medicine tasted like strawberries.
meanings.sent4: His remedial approach to problem-solving was refreshing.
meanings.sent5: The remedial treatment quickly healed the injury.

meanings.definition: Providing or receiving special help or instruction to correct a deficiency.
meanings.sent1: The school offered remedial classes for students who needed extra support.
meanings.sent2: He received remedial training to improve his job performance.
meanings.sent3: The remedial program made learning fun with games and activities.
meanings.sent4: Her remedial guidance helped him overcome his learning challenges.
meanings.sent5: The remedial intervention boosted his confidence in academics.
